com.pgmacdesign.pgmactips.utilities

Class TextFieldUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pgmacdesign.pgmactips.utilities.TextFieldUtilities

  • public class TextFieldUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to work on Edit Texts, TextViews, and other misc UI Elements that match extend certain views (IE Spinners) Created by pmacdowell on 8/15/2016.

      • setTextWithHtml

        public static <T extends android.widget.TextView> void setTextWithHtml(@NonNull
                                                                       T viewToSet,
                                                                       java.lang.String stringToSet)
        Set the textview with HTML style text IE, Words or "" + "Words Go Here" + ""

        stringToSet - The string to set

      • setTextWithHtml

        public static <T extends android.widget.TextView> void setTextWithHtml(@NonNull
                                                                       T viewToSet,
                                                                       java.lang.String stringToSet,
                                                                       java.lang.Boolean hasUrlLinks)
        Set the textview with HTML style text IE, Words or "" + "Words Go Here" + ""
        Type Parameters:
        T - T extends TextView
        Parameters:
        viewToSet - The view to set
        stringToSet - The string to set
        hasUrlLinks - Boolean, if true, will set the individual URL links to web clickable options. IE, if you have something like, "By continuing, you agree to our terms and conditions and privacy policy" where the 'terms and conditions' are one URL and the 'privacy policy' is another url, this will set each of those to open to their respective url links in the default web browser (IE chrome) so long as they are set with properly encoded HTML Tags. An example would be: String str = "Do you want to search on " + "" + "Google" + "" + " or " + "" + "Yahoo" + "" + "?"; NOTE! This will auto underlign and highlight the URL links with your app's "Primary color" (or accent color), so customize those colors if desired.

      • doFieldsMatch

        public static boolean doFieldsMatch(@NonNull
                                    android.widget.EditText et1,
                                    @NonNull
                                    android.widget.EditText et2)
        Checks if String in fields match one another. Does NOT compare case. Note, will return false if either is null or empty
        Parameters:
        et1 -
        et2 -
        Returns:
